alert.note: Alert for Golden Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 05 at 9:20AM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Billings MT has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Montana... Musselshell River near Lavina affecting Golden Valley County. Musselshell River near Shawmut affecting Wheatland County. .Heavy rainfall over the weekend, combined with the Musselshell River already flowing high with snowmelt, may result in minor flooding at times this week. In addition to the flood potential, the potential for significant bank erosion is very high with water flowing at these levels. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Musselshell River near Lavina. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low lying areas near the river is possible. Significant bank erosion is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM MDT Monday the stage was 8.4 feet. - The Musselshell River near Lavina continues to rise this morning, and is forecast to climb very close to flood stage by mid day Tuesday. With additional heavy rainfall possible over the week ahead, the forecast drops mid week may be overly optimistic. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Musselshell River Lavina 9.5 8.4 Mon 8 am 9.4 8.4 7.7 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Do not enter or cross flowing water or water of unknown depth. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe due to erosion. A Flood Watch means that flooding is possible. Now is the time to prepare for action in the event flooding occurs. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1015 PM MDT.
